podAntiAffinity.description: podAntiAffinity with two possible values: soft and hard

annotations.description: The key-prefix is optional and cannot exceed 253 characters with following character set: [a-z0-9A-Z.].The key cannot exceed 63 characters with following character set: [a-z0-9A-Z_.-]

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the apparmor profile for the backproxy container. Should only be set if appArmorProfile.backProxy.type is set to localhost

type.description: The AppArmor type for the backProxy container. Available options are "unconfined", "runtime/default", "localhost" and "" [default=""]

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the apparmor profile for the frontproxy container. Should only be set if appArmorProfile.frontProxy.type is set to localhost

type.description: The AppArmor type for the frontProxy container. Available options are "unconfined", "runtime/default", "localhost" and "" [default=""]

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the apparmor profile for the oamdashboards container. Should only be set if appArmorProfile.oamdashboards.type is set to localhost

type.description: The AppArmor type for the oamdashboards container. Available options are "unconfined", "runtime/default", "localhost" and "" [default=""]

yml.default:
opensearchDashboards.index: ".bam-oam-dashboards"
opensearchDashboards.branding:
applicationTitle: "Ericsson OAM Dashboards"
logging:
json: false
loggers:
- context: root
appenders:
- console
level: info
appenders:
console:
kind: console
layout:
kind: pattern
highlight: true
pattern: '[%logger] %meta %message'

basePath.description: Enables to specify a path to mount OpenSearch Dashboards if running behind a proxy

opensearchHosts.description: Host configuration for oam-dashboards to back-proxy

disabled.description: Used to disable optional plugins during Pod Startup

rewriteBasePath.description: Specifies whether OpenSearch Dashboards should rewrite requests that are prefixed with

serverHost.description: Host configuration for front-proxy to oam-dashboards

enabled.description: This allows the service to send Fault Indications

host.description: The destination host when sending Fault Indications, no protocol but including port

functionControlHost.description: Function control evaluation host, no protocol, including port

functionControlNoTlsHost.description: Function control evaluation non TLS host, no protocol, including port

interval.description: The interval to check status of featureflag and raise/clear alarms. The maximum allowed value is 600

secondsPerSeverity.description: Seconds for each alarm severity to exist before increasing severity. The maximum allowed value is 43200

connectionTtlMinutes.description: Log connection TTL (minutes) towards log transformer service. Connection will reset after configured number of minutes. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

level.description: Log level, possible values are: debug, info, error

queueSize.description: Size of the log queue for streaming. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

streamingMethod.description: The local parameter for specifying the streaming method of service logs. It can be ‘indirect', ‘direct', ‘dual', or null. If set to null, global.log.streamingMethod will be used to determine the streaming method

timeoutSeconds.description: Timeout waiting for logs to be streamed (in seconds) before terminating. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

transformerHost.description: FQDN including port number of the log transformer service, don't include protocol. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

transformerNoTlsHost.description: FQDN including port number of the log transformer non tls service, don't include protocol. Required when streamingMethod is set to direct or dual

authnProxyLoginURL.description: Full login url of the authentication proxy service to perform authorization code grant flow to fetch the tokens from IAM. Mandatory if upstream service requires access from the GUI. Example:

caSecret.description: Secret name containing a CA for the oidc connection. Mandatory if config.oidcAuth.enabled=true

clientId.description: ClientId to validate in case of id_tokens, if access tokens will be used then this should be the audience. Mandatory if config.oidcAuth.enabled=true

groupsClaim.description: Claim used to extract group memberships from JWT.

usernameClaim.description: Claim used to extract user from JWT.

issuerUrl.description: Full url to the oidc, only https is accepted. It supports multiple issuerUrl with comma separator. Mandatory if config.oidcAuth.enabled=true

noTlsUrl.description: Full url including protocol to the searchEngine service with TLS disabled

url.description: Full url including protocol to the searchEngine service

port.description: Port to expose the opensearch dashboard service

annotations.description: Global annotations. Global, service level, and resource-specific labels are merged, no conflicts are allowed

manual.description: Sets a fsGroup ID for all services. If manual set to empty namespace default configuration is used.

namespace.description: Sets a fsGroup to use namespace default. The following values are possible: true, false and "". If global.fsGroup.namespace set to "" or false, namespace default configuration is used.

internalIPFamily.description: InternalIPFamily configures the IP address family used for cluster-internal IP address. Available values are: IPv4, IPv6, and empty.

labels.description: Global labels. Global, service level, and resource-specific labels are merged, no conflicts are allowed

streamingMethod.description: The global parameter for specifying the streaming method of service logs. It can be ‘indirect', ‘direct', ‘dual', or null. If both global.log.streamingMethod and log.streamingMethod are set to null, it will choose ‘indirect' by default

supplementalGroups.description: SupplementalGroups is used for setting the GID value(s) for volume data that is used by the services. The value will be merged if both global and local value are set. supplementalGroup will not be set in helmchart if both global and local value are not set

pullSecret.description: PullSecret used when fetching the image

url.description: Registry url to fetch image from

enabled.description: Configuration option to enable/disable TLS support

rolekind.description: Configuration of the security policy role kind. The following values are possible: ClusterRole, Role and "". Rolebinding will not be created with value ""

url.description: Registry url to fetch image from

repoPath.description: Repo where the image is located

url.description: Registry url to fetch image from

repoPath.description: Repo where the image is located

pullSecret.description: PullSecret used when fetching the image

tag.description: Image tag, will override the default tag derived from the chart app version

caSecret.description: External CA secret name which is validated by rbac proxy service

ca.description: CA to verify incoming requests from OAM ingress, mandatory if ingress has been installed with clientCertificate.enabled=true

labels.description: A map for setting custom labels for all Kubernetes resources

oam-dashboards.description: This parameter is a placeholder for adding a list of egress traffic network policy labels. If this service wants to send traffic then it should add all its outgoing traffic network policy access labels using this parameter

enabled.description: The network policy will be enabled if both networkPolicy.enabled and global.networkPolicy.enabled are set to true

priorityClassName.description: Priority class name to use for the pod.

supplementalGroups.description: SupplementalGroups is used for setting the GID value(s) for volume data that is used by the services. The value will be merged if both global and local value are set. supplementalGroup will not be set in helmchart if both global and local value are not set

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before probe is initiated

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before probe is initiated

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before probe is initiated

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before probe is initiated

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before probe is initiated

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before probe is initiated

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out

create.description: Set whether to create the RBAC

cpu.description: The maximum amount of CPU to allocate to the backProxy container

memory.description: The maximum amount of memory to allocate to the backProxy container

cpu.description: The amount of CPU required by the backProxy container

memory.description: The amount of memory required by the backProxy container

cpu.description: The maximum amount of CPU to allocate to the frontProxy container

memory.description: The maximum amount of memory to allocate to the frontProxy container

cpu.description: The amount of CPU required by the frontProxy container

memory.description: The amount of memory required by the frontProxy container

cpu.description: The maximum amount of CPU to allocate to the oamdashboard container

memory.description: The maximum amount of memory to allocate to the oamdashboard container

cpu.description: The amount of CPU required by the oamdashboard container

memory.description: The amount of memory required by the oamdashboard container

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the seccomp profile for the backProxy container. Should only be set if seccompProfile.backProxy.type is set to localhost

type.description: Feature of the Linux kernel for secure computing mode for backProxy container. Available options are,,and "" [default=""]

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the seccomp profile for the frontProxy container. Should only be set if seccompProfile.frontProxy.type is set to localhost

type.description: Feature of the Linux kernel for secure computing mode for frontProxy container. Available options are,,and "" [default=""]

localhostProfile.description: Localhost path to the seccomp profile for the oamdashboards container. Should only be set if seccompProfile.oamdashboards.type is set to localhost

type.description: Feature of the Linux kernel for secure computing mode for oamdashboards container. Available options are,,and "" [default=""]

rolename.description: Rolename sets the name of the security policy role that is bound to the service account.

discoveryServices.description: Name of service which discovers this service as a micro front-end service

create.description: Set whether to create the service account

name.description: Name of the serviceaccount to be used

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Number of seconds after SIGTERM caught before shutting down

maxSurge.description: The number of pods that can be created above the desired amount of pods during an update

maxUnavailable.description: The number of pods that can be unavailable during the update process
